security_audit.summary: This skill is a pure markdown prompt file providing guidance to AI assistants. It contains no executable code, scripts, or direct system access capabilities. The skill only offers instructions for designing blockchain bots using the Silverback SDK framework.

content.user_title: Create blockchain monitoring bots with Silverback
content.value_statement: Creating blockchain bots requires understanding event-driven architecture and risk management. This skill guides AI assistants to help users design, implement, and deploy automated bots that respond to on-chain events.
actual_capabilities: Guide users through blockchain bot design patterns
Explain event handling for blocks, logs, and cron triggers
Advise on risk management and circuit breakers
Describe state management for bot operations
limitations: Does not execute blockchain transactions directly
Requires user to install Silverback CLI separately
Does not provide pre-built bot templates
Does not access blockchain networks directly

use_cases.title: Bridge and sync systems

prompt_templates.title: Simple event monitor
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a Silverback bot that listens for new blocks on Ethereum mainnet and logs block numbers and timestamps.

prompt_templates.title: Event filter bot
prompt_templates.scenario: User needs smart contract event monitoring

prompt_templates.title: Risk-managed automation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a bot with circuit breaker protection and configurable limits via environment variables for automated trading.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-chain aggregator
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a bot that monitors multiple chains, tracks derived metrics, and triggers actions based on complex threshold conditions.

faq.question: Which blockchain networks does Silverback support?
faq.answer: Silverback supports any EVM-compatible network including Ethereum, Polygon, Arbitrum, and Optimism.

faq.question: What programming language is used for Silverback bots?
faq.answer: Silverback bots are written in Python using the Ape framework for blockchain interaction.

faq.question: How do I connect external services like Discord or Telegram?
faq.answer: Use Python client libraries in your event handlers to send messages via webhooks or bot APIs.

faq.question: Is it safe to run bots with signing capabilities?
faq.answer: Only after thorough testing. Use environment variables for keys and implement circuit breakers for safety.

faq.question: Why is my bot not receiving events?
faq.answer: Check network configuration, verify contract addresses, and review logs for connection or filter errors.

faq.question: How does this compare to other blockchain automation tools?
faq.answer: Silverback offers full Python flexibility for custom logic whereas alternatives may have limited scripting.
